showScoreExcerpt:
"The new musical Gettin' the Band Back Together begins with a statement from 'The Host,' a sort of warm-up guy/emcee, that the show is a rare thing on Broadway these days: 'a totally original musical.' However, this statement belies the fact that the show is both generic and clich√©d, borrowing pieces of much more successful shows such as 'The Full Monty,' 'School of Rock,' 'Bandstand,' 'Groundhog Day,' 'The Wedding Singer,' and going all the way back to 'Bye Bye Birdie.'"
